alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:48PM MST until July 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County near Show Low in north central Arizona... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 247 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Show Low, Wagon Wheel, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Fort Apache Reservation and Fool Hollow Lake Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 334 and 348. Highway 60 between mile markers 336 and 345. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 349. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Silver Creek, Hog Wash, Billy Creek, Rocky Arroyo, Forestdale Creek, Linden Draw, Show Low Creek and Walnut Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
